intro: Phymaspermum carnosulum, commonly known as the fleshy-seeded phymaspermum, is a rare and unique plant belonging to the family Phymaspermataceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its distinctive feature is the fleshy, berry-like fruits that contain the seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by animals. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
